comment.text:
What I find very strange about this case are the photos. At one point, they are smiling and enjoying their trip together at every photo they take, even when only one of them is being photographed by the other. But then suddenly Kris is being photographed from a far distance. 

She has a different facial expression. What suddenly changed that she's not smiling anymore? 

She carried a bottle of a water with her. Why did she carry the bottle if they had a backpack? Why would she wanna carry a bottle of water with her while walking through such a hard terrain? 

Why would Lisanne photograph Kris when she was turned back? I would understand that if the photos were taken on an i-Phone. When you photograph on an i-Phone you usually don't care what you document because later the photos can be easily organized and deleted. But when you have a camera, it's a different experience. First of all, the process of taking photos isn't that fast as it is on a phone (especially in 2014 with an older technology) so you think about what you photograph. Second of all, it's annoying going through every single photo later and check whether you like them or not so you don't take random photos at a place where's basically nothing. Third, this was a jungle, their hands were probabaly sweating and they must've been tired. Why would they photograph if they didn't have to? Forth, those are young girls we talk about. I'm a girl and we usually care about how we look, what and why we photograph, we want to give emotions, meaning and story to a photo. I would never photograph my friend turned back on a camera because there isn't a usual reason for it. 

Why didn't Kris stop and take a photo of Lisanne as well? At every place they took a photo it was both of them who were there. Suddenly it's only Kris at several photos. 

Why would they take 10 of 100 photos on April 1st, then 7 days nothing and then 90 photos during night on April 8th?
comment.author: @britneysexyy

comment.text:
The evidence clearly shows that it was murder because of the clean cut above the one girl's ankle and skin rolled into a ball? How would anyone know that detail other than the murderer or the victim. But how many people were involved. Like how did the woman find the backpack that turned it in. The taxi driver mixing up the time he dropped off the girls. Was it deliberately done or did he really believe the time he stated was the correct time. 

But all the attempts to call for help suggests to me they were being followed by someone or something had already happened to one or both of them. Since they say the attempt to get help begins early on. But also someone had no knowledge of what the password to the phone was. So, one or both could have been seriously injured or dead near the beginning of their trip into the jungle. 

But why no photos with the dog they were supposed to be walking. The dog made it back home, but the girls didn't. In the photos it doesn't even look like they're walking a dog. But perhaps it was sitting out of view as the girls took random pictures. 

But the sudden shift from happy day photos of the girls to night photos of just wilderness is odd. Can it be confirmed they were taken in the same general area? Doesn't seem like it based on the information supplied. None of the night photos show the girls or anyone else. 

It is possible 2 girls could have met someone most likely a local or someone familiar with the area could have offered to be their guide. But if that's the case whomever that person or group is they made the girls feel comfortable assuming the girls met them towards the beginning of their trip into the jungle. Cause at certain points both girls are in the photo together so who is taking the photo of them then? Ok maybe they set a timer, perhaps but at the angle the photo was taken if a timer was used a high enough rock or something would have to have been available to set the camera on. Otherwise someone else was already hiking along with them during their first few moments of happiness on the hike snapping pictures of themselves. 

Some of the photos clearly indicate one of the girls was holding the camera or phone while both were in view. Cause the camera shot shows their arms extended as far as possible as i have done myself trying to take a selfie in similar fashion to what appears in some of their photos. 

But the photos where only one girl is seen. It is possible the other girl took those photos, but someone else could have done that too because they remain hidden out of sight. So, maybe the girl not seen in the photos where only one is visible took those pictures, but then again why is there only one girl visible? 

Given the circumstances that someone obviously cut one of their feet off cleanly. Likely is the same person that removed their SIM cards and deleted a photo (or photos) 

And maybe that is the reason why they could not get any response from emergency services because their sim cards were removed. But at one point they  did or someone did briefly make a connection with emergency services. But the call was either dropped or whomever had control over the phone ended the call.  If it was the girls they would not have deliberately ended the call. Someone else up to no good would have been motivated to turn off the phone and remove the SIM cards and delete photos. 

Obviously someone else was involved. Cause i don't think it is very easy to cut off your own foot. And why would anyone cut off their own foot? Maybe if they're trapped in something and their foot is caught and if they don't cut off their foot they will never escape. But that theory doesn't make sense. Since there apparently wasn't anything to indicate the girl was trapped or needed to cut off her own foot. 

But the staging of the 1 shoe from each girl couldn't have been done by the girls themselves especially if they were already dead. And if the girls were both still in possession of both their shoes 1 of each shoe wouldn't also be missing. But why take a random shoe. To prevent someone from running away? Perhaps but anyone that wasn't dead and was determined enough to get away from danger would find a way to escape with or without their shoes, or bra, or cellphone. 

But the fact the bag was found dry during a rainy period and near the river edge. Suggests someone only fabricated where it was found. Cause if it was outside for a month or two it would shows signs of damage, but according to the report it looked brand new. 

This is another bit of evidence that shows another person was involved because the bag was turned in by some woman. But why did she have it and how did she know where to get it. She said it wasn't wherever it was found a day before. That could just be a convenient story to throw people off. Or maybe it is absolutely true. But it is odd just the same and it does show someone else was involved maybe the woman and the taxi driver were involved somehow. Or perhaps another person. 

But a combination of things may have happened perhaps one of them got injured and then someone took advantage of the vulnerability and attacked them. 

In any case someone else was involved. Therefore it isn't just an accident. 

Most people that go into the woods that doesn't have a suicide thought or doesn't get injured or murdered and isn't lost. They usually return within a few hours at most. That applies to the majority of people. Most people return safe from a hike in the woods. Generally most ambitious people don't plan to jump off a cliff to die, or get eaten by a bear or murdered. They plan to enjoy themselves and go home and earn lots of money and spend time with family and friends and maybe return to college or university or to work or just to return home to see family members or kids etc. 

The fact the girls didn't bring a lot of supplies and no camping stuff tells me they planned on returning at some point. But weren't planning to go on a short trip either. Cause they did bring some amount of supplies so they did intend to be away for a good portion of the day. If i was only going around the block walking a dog i wouldn't need food or drinks or to pack extra clothes or a camera etc. but since these girls were away from home it makes sense they would have their passports, but why would you only bring 1 of them for the hike, and why only 1 insurance card? But 1 of each for separate girls. Suggests either someone lost theirs, it was stolen, or those things weren't seen as necessary and left behind at the place they were staying. Personally i don't care how trustworthy someone else is i would not leave my passport and insurance card and ID just laying around. So, it makes sense the girls will bring those things along, but what does not make sense is why 1 passport and 1 insurance card but not all for the same girl. A woman is more likely to steal another woman's passport than a man because another woman is more likely to have a chance of looking like the other woman. But a man not possible. Although a man might steal a woman's stuff and maybe keep it as some sort of trophy, souvenir, or to sell to someone, or just take it to inconvenience the other person. 

But if a woman was involved the 2 girls probably would have let their guards down then if it was a man and woman working together the man could have over powered the unsuspecting girls. 

No way of knowing for sure what the hell happened exactly, but it is obvious someone else was involved. I don't necessarily like the look of my feet, but in spite of that i would not go hacking off my foot  and leave it in the woods. Then vanish not to be seen again while sipping margaritas on the beach in Panama without a foot. So, i doubt those girls would have deliberately hurt themselves then staged a scene to make it appear like they were murdered. Like their remains were found and some personal items. But how things were found and displayed points to someone else did it. Because if you found the 2 girls even if they're dead likely you would find both their shoes at the scene too. Especially how well they were laced up on the girl that had her foot cut off at the ankle. 

Maybe the random night photos were in order to see at night. But why not just wait until daylight and walk out the way they walked in? Can't walk without your foot. And can't walk away if you're already dead.
comment.author: @chriss3030

comment.text:
Seeing the Photo's shown and discussed here brings to focus the mystery of missing Photo #509... Put aside your emotional investment and preconceptions on the Disappearance of these two friends, and instead imagine yourself as the Panamanian who either finds, or is handed, this camera... What would your immediate actions be with this device?

In general there are three or four instances in the accepted timeline of the camera's discovery of people who could be responsible for the fate of Photo #509. 
The first person to consider as possibly being responsible is the person who originally had possession of the backpack of the two friends, and likely placed it on the banks by Alto Romero to be 'found'. The second may be someone IN Alto Romero, curious about this found backpack and what is on that camera. The third in the chain might be the Police whom the Guide handed it over to. The Fourth might be the Media persons who gained access to the Camera's memory card two or three days after it was handed into the police's hands... indeed while these are the four main considerations as to who may have interfered with the cards content and deleted Photo #509 before it was handed over the Dutch authorities, the reality is - the whole business it a complete mystery. We CAN only speculate.

But there are still basic truths here I feel. With a Memory card that may well contain around 200 or more images anyone curious about the camera's secrets would find that using the camera's own view-screen to look at the images is a chore. A better and instant overview of its content would come by accessing the Memory card on a computer or laptop, where the windows file explorer or any Image editing programme would allow thumbnails of ALL of the contents to be viewed at once, and the Photograph of choice easily accessed for a better look.
So imagine yourself as being one of these potential people accessing the Cards content, looking at the content you have an overview of thumbnails showing the flow of the images on the card, from the earliest showing these two girls setting off on the flight, to the many holidaying snaps and selfie's and good times being had, moving to the end of this run of bright daytime run, and a sudden change into black night photographs... a very dramatic change to be sure. 
What would your actions be here if you were one of these people in Panama with perhaps little or no knowledge of who these two girls pictured are?

The act of speaking about missing Photo #509 tends to get bogged down in wondering whether the image itself held something Important, and questions as to whether it was a deliberate act it disappeared or an accidental one. And yet if you put yourself in front of this folder on your computer showing the long rows of thumbnails of the images on that card, you inevitably will move your attention to the last of those images, the ones before the black nothingness of the night-time ones, and want to take a closer look... Photo #509 is generally accepted as being an image taken just after the final images at the stream, possibly showing another shot AT the stream or possibly a little further on somewhere, depending which direction the two girls decided to take. So if you are one of the people in Panama viewing these thumbnails on your computer and Photo #509 was one the very first of the night-time images you would not be likely to select it for attention as those black images generally held nothing at all of interest. If photo #509 was final daytime image before those night images though.... well yes, this is an image you might want to look at but more than that you would select that image as you see there is something interesting on it. In all fairness ALL of the final images of April 1st are 'interesting' and worth opening up and looking at, but apart from it being the final image of the daytime photographs #509 had to have held something more interesting still than the ones coming before it, as while some do ask whether it may have been 'cut' accidentally I myself don't find that a credible or realistic possibility. To 'Cut' you have to right-click and press cut, and even then your mistake is reversable. You can reverse the 'cut'. 

No, whoever did cut that image from the card did so very deliberately. Because of what it showed.
ALL of those final images on the daytime run of Photo's are worth inspection, they are all interesting, therefore any one of them could have been similarly 'cut'. But it was that final photograph that was targeted. And whoever did it believed that no one who inspected the camera and content would ever even suspect it had ever even existed - and there perhaps is another interesting point to think on. Whoever did it thought they were erasing it from all existence. No one would ever know there had even been a final photograph on April 1st other than the one left on the card showing Kris Kremers looking back at us ambiguously...
Setting that aside however the images following on from these though are the 90 night-time images. Imagine yourself opening the card, looking though the thumbnails on your computer, and all these dark meaningless images blending into one. Except for perhaps five. Five images that stand out in neon against the rest of those black dark shots as they show something lit up. The Boulder, the SoS display, Kris Kremers' fiery hair... any one of these is going to get your immediate attention. But are not worthy of 'cutting'? Even the image of Kris Kremers hair is fine as it is? You leave it all alone, you want the authorities to see THIS particular image, along with the ones on the last hike on that sunny day, but NOT image #509. Why? You have to ask on the motives at work here... as it really could be telling you something in itself. Just that one image out of 200-plus?

It only makes the fact #509 was the sole target for deletion all the more tantalising and telling. The one picture on that card, out of 200-plus images, that HAD to disappear.
comment.author: @davidmullen6011

comment.text:
We did a lot of investigation on this case.
    1. The night photos were all taken in the same spot. The girls were NOT moving location..
    2. There is no "missing" photo 509. This error happened when the SD card was removed and attempted to take a photo resulted in a count going from 508 to 509 but no photo is saved because no sd was in the camera. Then the sd card was put back in for photo 510+
    3. Only a few bones were found bleached, not all of them. Leanne's foot was found inside one of her shoes that still had flesh on it. This to me sounds like insects and animals couldnt get to the flesh because the shoe was in the way.
      4. The phone calls were roughly made at around the same time if the day each day. Close to sunrise.
      5. The theory is Kris had their only water bottle cramed into her front pocket. A bad place to put your obly water bottle. Seen in photo 506.
      6. The location of the night photos has not been definitively located. But assumed they made it to the first monkey bridge where one or both had an accident and they never left that location.
     7. The night photos were an attempt to light up the tree canopy above them to help reach a further distance to signal anyone who might be out searching for them. A signal beacon.
      8. Why didnt the beacon work? It was late and raining, no one was out on the trail.
     9. The backpack found was wet despite what some claim. Kris's phone had to be professionally dried before it could be analyzed. Meaning taken appart to dry out the electronics.
      10. We think they passed a way near the river/streams edge and heavy rains flash flooded the stream carrying their bodies down stream.
      11. No signs of foul play. Money found in the backpack wasnt taken. Their cellphones could have been sold or destroyed to hide any potential evidence. The canera could have also been taken, sold or desteoyed to hide evidence.
     12. A kidnapper would most likely take their shoes from them. This prevents two things, harder to run a way without shoes on. And shoes make for decent defensive weapons. A SA would take their shoes, but they found the shoes near their bones.
    13. All credulous claims about edited photos have been debunked.
     14. Why would a person take an sd card, delete 1 photo using a computer then put it back in the backpack? Just delete them all. The mystery ends up the same. "Damaged camera deleted the data off the sd card" See one mystery is easily compounded.
comment.author: @krumplethemal8831

comment.text: It is interesting how Kris was unsmiling and looked uneasy in her last photo at the river. Given the mood of their previous photos, they should both have been ideally standing on those rocks together smiling and taking photos together. The fact that this particular photo shows Kris alone at a distance on the river looking back with an uneasy expression on her face is a cause for concern. Even if she had instructed Lisanne to take a solo photo of her, she should have at least been smiling and posing because she was comfortable in her friend's company. This leads me to believe that they had already encountered their assailant(s) at this time. Perhaps it was the assailant behind the camera taking a photo of Kris for whatever reason hence her worried expression. The argument that they got lost holds no water simply because of the state some of their remains were found in and the detective is right, they would have left at least a message or something narrating what went wrong. Their bodies would also have been found intact because they would probably have died of starvation if they got lost in the jungle. The night photos are the biggest puzzle in my opinion. It makes no sense at all that they would suddenly decide to use the camera as a flash to illuminate the way after all those days. Even if that is the case, it doesn't explain the photos of the sky or kris' hair with hints of blood on it. I actually thought that that photo could have been Kris herself holding the camera behind her head to try and take a picture of the wound in order to assess the damage. If that is true, then it means that she must have been alone at this point and was probably taking pictures of the sky as a way to try and signal her position to Lisanne or potential search teams whom she would probably have expected to be on the lookout for them. The photos of the surrounding could then imply that something or someone was lurking nearby and she was trying desperately to see who/what it was. Based on the evidence, i know for a fact that it was murder. The only questions that remain unanswered are who did it, how they did it, why they did it and the location of the rest of the remains.
comment.author: @martinking2909

comment.text:
I'm sceptical of the murder theories, although they're understandable, given past crimes involving young women hikers in foreign countries. I have myself been seriously lost in the woods twice, and once guided out a young woman lost in the woods at night while I was camping just off the Appalachian trail. Each time it was dramatic how fast disorientation and panic set in - it's the panic-fear that makes one automatically do the opposite of what one should do. It's not like your car's GPS stops working on a road trip. It's more like falling off a cruise ship and watching it disappear over the horizon. I can only infer that in the most serious cases, especially after days of food deprivation and chronic anxiety and stress, disorientation could become so severe that the two inexperienced girls in the Panama case would begin acting almost pathologically confused, while desperate hope may have led them to forego goodbye messages for the sake of attempts to reach local rescue until the batteries in their phones went dead and it was too late.

I've watched a couple of the better pieced-together videos and I found myself getting sceptical of the murder theories when I saw too much bias in that direction. For example, some of the "happy" photos early on in their hike were slightly distorted or the clouds seemed mis-timed from one snap to the next or the one girl was supposedly a little depressed or anxious looking, and to me all that seemed overly subjective and irrelevant to any criminal activity. The idea of any killers allowing their victims to keep taking photos is ridiculous, not just because it creates possible evidence but because abduction and murder (rape also) is about having complete power and control over someone.

Why would a killer and not the girls turn the phones on and off? Only the girls had any reason to do that repeatedly, and if they had the chance to do so around an abductor, they also would have had the chance to escape. The backpack could have been misplaced by the girls in their disoriented state until a villager found and took it, then returned it, dry, to the same (or a different) spot once they got wind of rescue efforts for the owner of the backpack and realized it might implicate them in more than just “finders, keepers.”

As for the photos in the camera, how would taking dozens of photos of the sky at night serve to mislead police? And the height-distorted photo of Lisanne? Digital photos occasionally are goofy like that (I have a rear-view pic of my motorcycle where the panniers look like two different sizes). The clouds at the trail overlook completely mismatching in photos taken seconds apart? Weird, but how does that suggest foul play, when the girls are posing normally? The deleted photo? A tech-savvy killer would only take the batteries out of the phones and throw everything in the river or bury it all, making deleting photos unnecessary and also increasing the mystery to the killer’s advantage. Anyways, why disguise a murder as an accident, when both possibilities (murder or losing their way) are going to be speculated about regardless? I can certainly see the girls using the camera flashes to attempt signalling toward airplane sounds and checking for hazards in their path (note the one photo of a dangerous drop down a rock). Furthermore, why would a killer force-march two victims miles through a jungle, only to kill them in the middle of nowhere? That makes no sense - killers aren't lazy, but what advantage would there be to the killer?

I think these girls just got hopelessly lost, and that leads me back to my own experiences of being lost in the woods - the more you try to guess your way out in a panicked and confused state of mind, the more lost you get. To me, the most important thing about this tragedy isn't how the girls died, but the decisions they made leading up to their disappearance. They'd worked hard as waitresses in the Netherlands to save for the trip and they were young, idealistic and eager, so it's understandable they'd be adventurous. But they'd already reached their goal of living in that small tropical town in Panama and they hadn't even seriously explored the town itself yet. They had a guided hike scheduled for the next day. What was the hurry to get into the jungle? Going to extremes is always a dangerous thing, and getting too adventurous too soon was going to an extreme. I think the girls were their own killers.
comment.author: @craigfinnegan8534

comment.text:
I am almost certain the night photos show the stars and not rain as most people have assumed.  This is why the ground and Kris' hair is dry when people thought it was rain in the photo's.  You can see the same constellations in many of the night photos.  Using this info. someone should now be able to now locate their last location.   They may have left a message at his place.

There only needs to be a search of waterways upstream from where the bones were found.  It is less than 5km to the highest point of the mountain from this place.

I believe the night photo's were to help us find their last location as most photo's are of what I initially thought was the North star.  That is where the large V shaped tree is.  (I need help with the star identification)  

The large V shaped tree seems to be quite unusual.  If you look at drone footage (On YT) of this area.  There does not look to be that many of these trees close to creeks.  This may assist to find the location of the night photos.

My initial thought was they were at the base of an old or currently dry waterfall (I think the water comes from the south or west) If true this will explain bag, shoes etc. being found weeks later after a wet season washed it downstream.

Some of the night photos may also have the moon in them.  You can check the moon charts and it seems to line up with the photos.  This may help to find the location.

Night photo of Kris' hair - You can see her black triangular earing at the bottom of the night photo of her hair. (towards the right) She had these on in the earlier beach photos.  All the photo experts can now do some analysis and super imposing to check this. Need to also check she had these on this day. I checked the lookout photos and they do appear black. I think this makes the pink skin in the middle/bottom Kris' left cheek so I think it is her left ear. It appears Lisanne has covered Kris up (with her hair) out of respect for her friend.

Hopefully we can find the location of the night photos.

RIP K&L
comment.author: @darren1512

comment.text: You've thought of this a lot and put a much effort into it. Interesting ideas and angles you discuss. Here are some notes I took while watching. 1) What was the tour guide and taxi driver's schedule? Could they verify their whereabouts during these 11 days? 2) How could they have come back like the American states if there's evidence of them traveling for up to 11 days? 3) Using the camera for light would not only burn up the battery but also would not require flash. Perhaps they didn't have the flashlight app on their phone. The picture of Kris's head looked very fake as if it was a wig. Her hair was not curly like that and the color looks a little off. Didn't look real in my opinion. I can see someone wanting it as a "souvenir" but it was on their phone so he wouldn't have access to it once it was found. Were the attempts to get in someone's phone an attempt to look at the photos and see if anything was incriminating? 4) How far were the bones from each other? 5) What is on photo 508 and 510? 6) The photos showing Kris in the distance, where is her backpack? 7) Did they both take dark photos? 8) What order are the photos in meaning when were the dark photos compared to the distance photos etc. 9) What would cause the fracture that Lisanne had in her foot? 10) I didn't see any distant photos of Lisanne. Were they all of Kris? 11) If those "distance" photos were not being taken by one of the girls then how could he have found them starving and dehydrated in the forest? Those photos indicate he was traveling with them for awhile and Kris looked okay. 12) I need more clarity on the timeline of the photos and when we think the girls may have been followed or abducted. 13) How far away is the tour guide's coffee farm from the bones, the backpack, the first fun photos etc. 14) Was he still working as a guide during these 11 days? How could he have been in so many places at once? Perhaps I'm misunderstanding the timeline. Do you have it written somewhere? That'd be great!
comment.author: @JewelsVern

comment.text: In one photo, blonde girl (Kris?) has her legs crossed while standing and one hand on her waist, looking at the camera with a kind of disappointed yet a little angry face expression (like, why am I here?). Some women stand on crossed legs when they don't know the people around them, so more closed type of stance which also can mean access to genital areas is denied. It just gives some kinda clue that there was a third party with them in their last pictures. Maybe that's why they never had photos together again because they were unhappy with the situation. Until this point, it would be safe to say Lisa was alive whether Lisa was taking the photos or a third party. Because Kris would not be that calm in photos if Lisa wasn't alive or in trouble. What comes to my mind is, the tour guide Feliciano goes to where Kris and Lisa stayed, the next morning. Meaning, whatever happened, already happened up until that point. He had enough time to lure the girls to go off track and a little more into the jungle, do whatever he could and hide them at his coffee farm in the middle of jungle. And then, go to the girls' hostel next morning as if he knows nothing about them. Yes, i agree we shouldn't just blame people without evidence, but human instincts tell me this is way too fishy to be an accident or getting lost scenario. These girls were two young, strong, intelligent adult women coming from a developed country to have fun and holiday, knowing enough about not getting deep into the the wilderness of the jungle alone and means of emergency. In other words, they would have turned back when they felt something was wrong before even calling emergency. But they didn't. Someone or something forced them to go deeper in the jungle. No one is that stupid. Even two adult guys without proper equipment and experience would definitely not go deep in an unknown jungle or forest to them. And you just can't lose your way in a one-way track, come on. A kid could go back from the same track if they think they got lost.  My theory is, the guide Feliciano and/or his son(s) followed the girls up until the summit. Then, Feliciano shows up (alone or not) and greets the girls, tells them he is happy to be there with them and he can show around. Girls think, it is around noon, a sunny clear day and it is not someone else but the guide they had reservation with anyway. The last photos are taken after this point showing only Kris and she seems unsettled, has these suspicious-vague looks in her face in the photos. I won't analyze the whole event details because in this video any in many others it's been analyzed over and over but lastly, the guy saying in Spanish "I told you not to tell them anything" just makes it jackpot, bingo, whatever you call it. And you know those trivial movies where they show one specific suspect for the murder and the killer turns out someone nobody expected? Well, 1) This is not a movie, 2) This is not happening in a closed environment with certain amount of people. 3) How many people can kill and shed the bodies away from police in the middle of a jungle? Only locals. The tour guide and his sons or the local villagers? Many arrows point at the tour guide. Him, alone or with his people. Just get them to talk, it's never too late. I just learned about this incident yesterday while surfing on the net. I felt so sorry for the girls and their parents, i couldn't sleep all night but kept reading and watching. If i were the parents of those girls, i would do whatever i can to make that sob tour guide talk and i am really honest with this. I would start with taking him for a walk in his own jungle. And who knows, maybe hours later, he would be the one trying to call the emergency numbers...I just looked at the crossed legs photo again. If you look closely, you will notice that the photo seems like it is taken at Kris' height level. We know Lisa is 184cm, much taller so at the terrain level, the top of Kris' head and whatever behind her should be visible if Lisa had taken Kris' photo while standing, but it is not. However, the tour guide is about Kris' height and if he took this photo, it would look normal height wise. Or maybe, Lisa kneeled down to take her photo. Last option is they were walking uphill which would only mean they were heading back to the summit when this photo was taken.  Another thing i remembered reading was the shoe of (Lisa?) with her foot in it being a clean cut in police records. No animal can do a clean cut even if they manage to bite her foot off of her body which is highly unlikely unless there is a bear or a tiger type of an animal. No falling can just chop off your limbs from your body in a jungle. Come on, this is not a plane crash with 300mph from 10,000 feet. But instead, a machete could perform this clean cut, just like Feliciano performed it on trees while he was guiding Kris' mother and others in the jungle.
comment.author: @execorder724

comment.text: My unique idea - I think the first part of the hike was very pleasant very happy. However I think it’s possible that F then stayed around the area to if others are going on the same path. Once he understood that no more hikers were coming he then quickly race to the girls but made it seem as if it was a pure coincidence that he was also walking through at that time. He then offered to show the girls his farm in the middle of the forest and probably claimed that there was some good scenery to take photos. This is potentially proven by the change in behaviour in the photos naturally when you’re with a friend or someone you know you can be yourself you can smile you can laugh. However when does the third-party that that you are not familiar with or is a stranger to you you start to act shy reserved and you’re often careful of how you behave. The missing picture is between the daytime and the night time- The last photos are taken of one girl only. It’s impossible to determine whether they have a girl took the photo or whether it was F when they were on their way to the middle of the jungle so that he could show them his farm. This would’ve been a good technique to prove to the girls that he was just being friendly while allowing them to the middle of the jungle by offering to take pictures of them on the way.  The missing photo 509 could be one of two things the first possibility could be that it was a picture of both of the girls this would prove that there was a third-party with them and therefore is deleted because it clearly shows that someone else was there and the second theory would be one of the photos was taken of F and one of the other girls by the other girl this would then put him at the scene. If his intention was to lead them into the middle of the jungle it would’ve been difficult for him to give a reason why he didn’t want to be in any photos and him being in a photo with the girls would have only made them trust him more. Also I would like to know but it’s impossible to determine the circumstance in which 911 or 112 was dialled. We often see that emergency numbers are dialled when not in obvious panic. If the girls suspected that F was getting awkward or there was a uneasy feeling it’s quite possible that they could have dialled it secretly. Hence the gaps in calls. Although gaps in calls could symbolise the need to preserve battery it could also show that they were trying to call in secret while with a third-party for example one of the girls was distracting him while another girl was trying to secretly dial 112 so that the authorities would know that there is something going on - in hopes that the authorities would be able to secretly listen to the conversation maybe while the phone was in the pocket and determine the location where they were. Ultimately I believe at one point F wanted a sexual favour in which the girls declined and run or there was a plan folder together when things started to go wrong where the girls would go run. This then causes the girls to hide in shallow ditches through the forest or behind trees in which they made panic calls to 911. When you are hiding and when you are running from somebody you have no time to to text or record a final message. With residents saying that they had scrims from the forest this could possibly be because a machete was used to run off to the girls or one of the girls was slaughtered hence the screams. Is also possible that one girl was killed and another girl was then taken to a secret spot in the forest and raped and then kept alive and slowly over the days was was cut with the machete which would explain the fresh skin because skin does not compose if the person is alive. It is also quite possible that somewhere in the forest one of the girls could be tied up or chained up without a leg and with skin cut of her.
comment.author: @TheMargoLife

comment.text: I was telling this story to my boyfriend and I mentioned all the theories about being lost, hurt, stumbled onto or found by gang or cartel, or even running into particularly dangerous male tribespeople (I believe it was the Ngabe tribe that was referenced). When I told him about the photos (of basically nothing/darkness) being taken in the middle of the night, 90 photos within seconds of each other, he said that sounds like possibly a person from a tribe who has maybe never seen of used a camera before, testing it out. Like a child with a camera. The photo of the back of Kris' head also struck me as obviously the creepiest, but why would that photo be taken? The theories were maybe she was injured and Lisanne took a photo for whatever reason. But we don't see any photos of Lisanne after early on. These are young, pretty Dutch girls who were naive and probably very trusting. Maybe they encountered tribesmen. Maybe the photos of night were taken by inexperienced tribesmen. Maybe one of them took a photo of the back of Kris' head, because they were fascinated by her strawberry blonde/red hair. Beyond that, I believe they were r.ped, killed, and if it was a cartel, possibly organ harvested. I don't give much to the supernatural/spirits theories, although I haven't read much about them. I'm open minded, but also realistic. Odds are, it was a man, or men.
comment.author: @youcantdiealonewithcats

comment.text:
Okay but this video never addresses THE most inexplicable (if calling it an accident) detail. The fact of the deleted photo. Between the last photo taken on the day they went missing, and the first of the night time photos, there is a missing photo number. If I’m not mistaken, it goes from 508 to 510. This photo was not recoverable, which means it wasn’t just deleted from the camera, but from the memory card. Of the hundreds of photos on the camera, it is the ONLY missing one. Also, it had to have been deleted AFTER the night time April 8 photos had been taken, otherwise the first of those would have become 509, and there would be no missing photo. It was found impossible for this to be a camera error. So, if someone can explain THAT, I’ll buy it is an accident.
And just some more food for thought that wasn’t mentioned...where did those bracelets lisanne is wearing come from? At first on their hike she isn’t wearing them, then suddenly she is...
comment.author: @meredithsickel2709

comment.text:
I've always been intrigued by that last day photo, in particular Kris' uneasy expression, what did she see? 

Also the missing photo 509, people seem to overlook the fact that to permanently delete a photo in this manner you would need to use a computer, because you can't delete the raw data of a photo on the camera. Which means that whoever deleted that photo had access to a computer, and did it purposely so that the photo could not be restored. Now why they would that I'm not sure, but it makes you wonder what was on the photo that meant someone would go out of their way to make sure it could never be seen again.
comment.author: @jumpcutfilms1958

comment.text:
let's clarify that mine are all assumptions so things could have gone very differently I found this case about ten days ago on the internet on YouTube and it bothers me that these two girls who in my opinion were murdered do not have justice here in Italy there is a saying “THINKING BADLY ABOUT OTHERS MAKES SIN…” “…but often one guesses” often used by Giulio Andreotti and in this case there is nothing that leads me to think of an accident
1) Looking at photos 580 and 541 if you hadn't seen the rest of the photos you would have ever associated those photos inside a jungle (I think not) so who says those photos weren't made to make believe that kris and lisanne were there in the jungle (I'm not an expert but if some expert photographer can tell us if it's possible to make changes to the photo by changing the date and time it would be appreciated)!!!
2) what makes you think that the girls were stuck in the jungle, just the fact of having seen those photos taken from 1.30 to 4.10 hence the persistence of the authors to stay more hours in the jungle let's say that these photos had been taken in 10 minutes, you might have thought that someone had gone there ten minutes had taken those pictures and gone but making it last more hours was more believable that Lisanne and kris were lost and it would have had a different effect in the eyes of those who would have seen the photos later and maybe that's exactly what the authors wanted us to believe so hence the need to spend more hours in the jungle, so it was enough for them to spend half a night taking insignificant photos in the jungle, maybe even away from the pianist and mirador ,( because as far as I know this location has never been identified) putting 541 and 580 between them to make it look like Kris and Lisanne were there for a week in the jungle, injured, and missing while perhaps they were imprisoned elsewhere and perhaps even near this place!!! If it really happened, it would explain why no photos were taken between April 2nd and 7th and even after until 11am kris' cell phone was turned back on so it's assumed one of them was alive (but I think whoever turned it back on is an outsider, it would explain why some of the girls' remains were found far from the mirador (they were taken), it would explain the fact that the jungle searches were inconclusive!!!3 I also have my doubts about who made the emergency calls when we discovered that these calls were made only after the backpack was found and the phones analyzed so whoever made those calls knew there was no signal in fact 'the only time the signal was caught instead of trying again they switched off In a nutshell, the cell phone did the opposite of what two people who wanted to be found would have done!!! Ps not to mention the pin of the missing photo and other things that don't add up or like the mysterious deaths of local youths so I wonder how the Dutch government passed the official story of the accident an accident would have had less whys and more answers!!!
