comment.text:
1. There is a lot of misinformation in this case. Like how the backpack was found dry and clean..... No, it wasn't. It was very dirty and the experts were barely able to save the phones, so a case of misreporting by the media. 

Photo 509 has widely been reported to had to have been deleted by software (implying "the killer" must have manually deleted just this one photo)  but this is also not true. 
That particular phone will skip the number of a photo or video attempt if it gets corrupted due to, say, water getting on the phone when that particular image/video is taken, OR if the phone was dropped in water........ 
In other words, if the file is corrupted , it will skip to the next number... So photo 509 was corrupted , then the next photo taken was 510. 
(No need to invoke a killer permanently deleting a photo)

Kris' pelvis bone DID have rodent damage, it was not "undamaged" as was misreported. 
ALSO, the "other" bones were washed up from a nearby cemetery...
(No need to invoke a "killer" who has killed and dumped the bones of many different victims.)
***THE ROLLED UP SKIN WAS NOT LISSANE'S (another case of misreporting) 

all the calls to 112 mean the girls had the use of their phones and were trying to reach emergency services  (would murderers allow.them to call police?) 
... wouldn't the would-be-murderers just destroy their phones? (and not just delete 1 photo) Why would killers leave ANY evidence which could. potentially lead police to them?



2. ...I think the girls got hurt and or lost, OR BOTH, and then perished and eaten by scavengers. Their bones could have made their way far downstream/upstream due to flooding or heavy rain and that would explain why they were found so far away from the trail. 
No foul play needed.


3. In one "night photo" you can see toilet paper on a rock and there is a small mirror in the middle. 
It is , i think, an unmistakable sign of an attempt to be found by overhead aircraft
 (the toilet paper is laid out as a message, e.g.  "SOS" or something similar , while the mirror, which is  face up, was  placed there in hopes of overhead aircraft seeing a reflection) 


4. I'm 90% certain there was no foul play, but that is my opinion. 

The Panamanian verdict of a "hiking accident" is the only story that makes any sense to me.

Plus , most experts don't see any evidence of foul play. I don't either....
comment.author: @BeatlesFan1975

comment.text: The skipped photo was a malfunction for sure. If there is absolutely no trace or data of that photo than that photo never existed. When you delete data, it is never truly deleted until it is overwritten, which is why investigators can still find deleted stuff in your computer. So if someone deleted that photo while leaving the ones you shared, they'd have to delete that single photo, full up the memory card and then delete the unnecessary photos while keeps the ones you shared. But then data of the unnecessary photos would still be found but Im guessing the unnecessary photos never existed so in conclusion, it was a malfunction.

The camera wouldnt come up and tell you an error code  that it had an accident and fell on rocks, so it registers how it does as a blank photo and or deleted photo. comment.text: Après la photo 508, elles ont dû sortir du sentier (il y a plusieurs possibilités : une envie présente, quelque chose qui bloque le passage, serpent ou autre) À ce moment là Kris s'est blessée (elle fait une chute grave (os du bassin cassé, cf : os retrouvé du pelvis) elle a dû tomber de haut. Lisanne s'est blessée en voulant l'aider, dans la panique elle glisse sur des rochers (fracture au pied, cf : chaussure retrouvé avec un pied en mauvais état à l'intérieur) les deux filles sont donc immobilisées, c'est pour cela qu'elles appellent une seul fois chacune les secours cette journée (vu qu'elles sont immobilisées elles ne peuvent pas se déplacer pour trouver du réseau et cherche à garder un maximum de batterie, 50% de charge en début de rando). Elles devaient passer leurs appels par wifi (pas de forfait téléphonique Panaméen) c'est pour cela qu'elle n'ont jamais essayé de contacter personne d'autre. Lisanne retire le short de Kris pour voir l'ampleur de la blessure (ce qui expliquerait le short retrouvé déboutonné et déchiré à l'arrière et non plié comme beaucoup le dise). Peut être que Kris décède entre ce moment et la journée du 8 ? Lisanne se retrouve seul mais le corps de Kris est à côté d'elle. (c'est pour cela qu'on voit que ses cheveux dans les photos de nuit). Photos qui ont été prisent juste pour flasher d'éventuel secours qui se trouvait proche de leur secteur (hélicoptère si elles sont sur l'autre versant de la montagne) ce qui expliquerait ce grand nombre de photos "étranges" prisent pendant presque 3h. Remarque anecdotique : La photo du "miroir" ça ressemble plus à un fond de canette. En ce qui concerne la photo (ou vidéo) manquante, elle n'a peut être pas été supprimée, peut être que lors de la chute Lisanne tenait l'appareil et qu'il a prit un coup ce qui à créé une erreur d'écriture ... elle se trouve peut être sur une autre carte SD qui n'a pas été retrouvée. Ex : Peut être que Kriss sentait qu'elle ne s'en sortirait pas et qu'elle a fait une vidéo d'adieu pour ces proches au cas où la carte SD serait retrouvée ... Cette carte serait donc resté avec Kris et Lisanne aurait réinséré la 1ère. Le fait qu'aucune autre photo à été prise entre temps ne me paraît pas étrange. Elles avaient d'autre chose à faire que des photos de vacance dans ce laps de temps. Le sac à sûrement été retrouvé par les gens qui vivent dans le coin, peut-être déposé ici pour la prime ?? (le sac n'était pas en si bon état, il y avait des feuilles et du sable à l'intérieur et des traces d'usure. Rien n'indique nul part que les affaires étaient sèche. Lisanne avait sûrement mis le sac à l'abri, pour protéger le peu d'affaire qu'elles avaient emmenés. C'est pour cela qu'il est encore en a peu près bon état. En ce qui concerne l'état différent des os, Lisanne à pû ramper jusqu'à un endroit plus sûr et plus frais après la mort de son amie et donc son corps s'est décomposé plus lentement. En ce qui concerne l'incapacité des secours à les retrouver, ils cherchaient essentiellement du côté d'el pianista et non sur l'autre versant.

comment.text: I don't think there was a third party, the photo of 509 being deleted could be a simple deletion by mistake after taking a few photos.  Another explanation is maybe one of the girls was badly injured and a photo was taken to send if they were to get a signal.  Then, after seeing how gruesome the injury is, she deleted it.  Also possible that she took photo 509 and 510 at the same time, but 509 was nothing, but a blurry photo.  My point is there are a few other options, but the main reason for the case against a third party is the photos after that make me think there wasn't a third party.  If there was a third party, I imagine they would destroy the phones just in case something could have been seen in the photos so you wouldn't be able to get the photos. The incorrect password could be explained by a head injury, lack of sleep causing memory loss, its possible something they ate affected them, but it cannot be ruled out a third party was involved.  I do think the most likely outcome was from a horrible accident mixed with unfamiliar place lead to the sad conclusion of those young women.

comment.text:
So the two men in the photo with them died right after..and their cab driver died as well. Obviously the women didn't simply get lost. There's an organized criminal group out there. I remember looking into this when it first came to light, imo someone went after them, these women put up a fight-very capable, caused them to get lost while hiding, but they later found them. One probably outlasted the other. They didn't die from exposure. The nights were warm (I recall looking at the weather, warm nights and no torrential rains, you can go back and find the old weather reports, even moon cycles AKA enough light to see at night) and there were 2 of them, plenty of water to drink and if you go downhill, which is the path of least resistance, you'll encounter a river, and there's homes along the river.. 

"You last 30 days without food, 3 days without water, 3 minutes without air." You know the saying. You can argue one fell or was snakebit..but it would be a much easier case to solve if that were the case. One could have easily ran for help. They'd have left a message on their phone for their family if they were out there in their final days or taken photos of the injury/bite or memorial for their dead friend etc. 

The killer could easily have taken those photos to make it look as if they just got lost. People get lost and died America all the time, many could have just been picked off by serial killers or pedophiles or traffickers and organ harvesters. They disappear and no one gets caught. Those Missing 411 films are greats.

comment.text:
Pour la photo 509, il y a une explication plus simple. Le ou les tueurs auraient simplement supprimer la photo de l'appareil directement depuis ce dernier. En effet, tous nos dispositifs de stockage (disques durs, cartes sd, clés usb...) disposent de ce qu'on appelle un système de fichier. Ce dernier dicte comment sont organisées les données sur le dispositif de stockage.

Sans rentrer dans les détails, la plupart des systèmes de fichiers ne suppriment pas réellement de la donnée. Quand on supprime un fichier sur ordinateur, on dit juste à Windows de marquer le fichier sur le disque dur comme étant "supprimé" ce qui veut dire qu'on pourra ré-écrire dessus. Le fichier semble disparaitre mais il est en réalité toujours là. Il y a bien sûr une façon de lire plus en détail le système de fichier et de remplacer toutes les données du fichier "supprimé" par des 0, plutôt que de seulement indiquer qu'on peut réecrire dessus. C'est un processus plus long, et c'est exactement la différence entre un formatage rapide et un formatage total où dans ce cas des 0 sont réellements réecrits partout pour tout effacer.

Pour en revenir à cas-ci, il faut s'intéresser au modèle d'appareil photo. Le développeur qui a programmé la fonction de suppression sur ce dernier a très bien pu passer par une fonction de suppression totale (qui réecrit le fichier avec des 0 donc), soit volontairement, soit par méconnaissance : un développeur ne se base que sur des boîtes à outils pré-existantes pour programmer ce qu'il souhaite, il n'est donc pas rare de ne pas totalement tout maîtriser dans les détails pour arriver à programmer ce que l'on souhaite.

Et MÊME si la photo n'était pas totalement supprimée à la suppression via l'appareil, les photos suivantes qui ont été prises ont sûrement fini d'achever ce qu'il restait de la photo 509, puisque la zone de stockage a été marquée comme pouvant être écrasée.

Je ne vois pas pourquoi sinon les tueurs se seraient embêtés à aller supprimer cette photo uniquement via un ordinateur, alors qu'ils auraient pu juste détruire la carte mémoire.
comment.author: @MrSpaceVector

I don’t know what happened but protecting the tourism industry should never be overlooked. An wow, a guy who took a photo of them died days later mysteriously…yea foul play is looking more likely.

comment.text: There is absolutely no way that the girls got lost on the Pianista trail.  Photo 509 is the key as it most likely reveals the people responsible for their disappearance, that is obviously why it was erased at a later date with a computer.  The emergency calls after the 1st day and the night time photos are subterfuge.  The emergency calls on the 1st day, April 1, are most likely from the girls, but all after that day are not from them.  For argument's sake, let's say that the girls kept walking past the Mirador on the other side of the continental divide past the small waterfall in photo 508.  If the 1st emergency phone call was at 4:39 PM and the girls reached the Mirador at roughly 1:00 PM, then they would still be walking on the trails for over three hours before the 1st emergency call.  Let's say that they did eventually get lost, then why aren't there any photos of them on the trail after 508? They wouldn't have gotten lost right away, so they would still be walking and enjoying themselves and taking photos.  If you believe in the sequential order of the photos, then they obviously ran into some people right after 508 and 509 is most likely a photo of those people.   They then led them down another path never to be seen again.  If the sequence of the photos was changed, then they most likely returned to the base of the trail and were then intercepted by some guys who convinced them to take a ride with them.  Either way the girls never got lost on the trail.
comment.author: @EndoftheTownProductions

comment.text:
Very nice job! 2 more further points I'll make that will definitely concretely prove what you say about the girls returning. 

1) The photo at 16:52 and the other photo at 20:10 were both pointing in the same direction with the same background. If you look very carefully at the sky and the cloud coverage in both photos, you'll see that the clouds were very different. This proves that there was a significant time gap between the two photos being taken which indeed suggests 2 trips to the summit.

2) Now let's compare the photo at 16:52 to the one at 20:35. In the 20:35 photo towards the up and right of Lisanne's head, you'll see a section of the mountain in the background that is shaded. In the 16:52 video, much more of that section is shaded. This proves that in both photos, the sun was in different positions in the sky. This also suggests a significant time gap between the photos and therefore 2 trips to the summit.

The only part about your theory that I have a problem with is that you say you think they made emergency calls from the car that they were riding in, and then later had a great time drinking and swimming with the guys. That's the only thing that doesn't seem realistic to me.

Anxiously awaiting your part 3. Hope the bad guys (the ones that are still alive at least) get caught and thrown in jail.
comment.author: @aaronlilley5007

comment.text:
Pas du tout d'accord sur la preuve de la photo 509 qui invaliderait la thèse accidentelle. Vous partez du principe qu'il est très facile et systématique de récupérer une photo effacée via des logiciels et que si elle a été effacée, c'est via un ordinateur. Or c'est faux. Il n'y a aucune garantie de récupérer un fichier effacé d'une carte SD, sans pour autant qu'il ait été effacé par ordinateur. Cela s'est vérifié dans d'autres enquêtes. C'est possible mais loin d'être automatique.

Restait-il de la place sur la carte SD? J'ai eu un numérique il a des années de cela et il m'arrivait d'effacer les photos sans intérêt à posteriori pour faire de la place. Or les photos qui nous semblent si étranges (car nous n'avons aucune idée de ce qu'il s'est passé) peuvent avoir eu un intérêt supérieur pour celle qui les a prise (localisation d'un lieu, du corps de sa copine).

Ou bien la photo effacée peut l'avoir été totalement par hasard, ça m'est arrivé de multiples fois d'appuyer sur le mauvais bouton en faisant défiler ou en voulant trier mes photos sur ce genre d'appareil. 
Et si les filles ont passé autant de tps ds la jungle et que la thèse de l'accident est la bonne, elles ne devaient plus être en possession de ts leurs moyens, désorientées, affamées, affaiblies physiquement, mentalement, peut-être des hallucinations. Il faut les imaginer vulnérables, perdues ds un milieu inconnu, dangereux avc la nuit, les bruits, les animaux (peut-être une attaque, une morsure, une piqûre) et l'une d'elle a pu se retrouver seule, choquée, démunie si la copine a eu un accident ou n'est pas morte tout de suite et se retrouver ds un état de conscience modifié avec la faim, d'où les photos étranges.

Idem qd vous dites qu'on les aurait forcément retrouvées vu qu'il y a eu des recherches. Je pense que c'est négliger la densité de la jungle dans ces régions, même sur un petit périmètre. 

Je n'exclus pas du tout la piste criminelle mais ce n'est pas une évidence selon moi. Chaque élément en faveur de cette thèse est réfutable. En tous les cas, c'était passionnant.
comment.author: @sophie_nv

comment.text:
L'une des premières vidéos que j'avais regardé de Lionel , en 2017. Disparitions toujours aussi intrigantes et émouvantes en 2022.
Très intéressant d'avoir refait une vidéo avec de nouvelles photos et des explications très claires du déroulé des événements.

Beaucoup d'importance est attaché à la disparition de la photos 509. Mais je doute qu'il y ait eu besoin d'un ordinateur pour la supprimer. Je m'explique : il est est possible que la photo ait été supprimée non pas directement après que la photo ait été prise mais tout simplement après que d'autres photos aient été prises par la suite. (Au moment d'un revisionnage des photos prises auparavant par exemple)

Dans ce cas l'appareil n'aurait pas pu remplacer automatiquement les numéros de toutes les photos suivantes pour que les numéros se suivent.  D'où la disparition de la photo 509.

En tout cas c'est deux disparitions sont bien tristes. Je rends hommage à ces deux jeunes filles et j'adresse mes condoléances à leur famille.

Vidéo tres bien réalisée. Merci Lionel.

comment.text: I believe it was an accidental unalive. The skipped photo was a malfunction for sure. If there is absolutely no trace or data of that photo than that photo never existed. When you delete data, it is never truly deleted until it is overwritten, which is why investigators can still find deleted stuff in your computer. So if someone deleted that photo while leaving the ones you shared, they'd have to delete that single photo, full up the memory card and then delete the unnecessary photos while keeps the ones you shared. But then data of the unnecessary photos would still be found but Im guessing the unnecessary photos never existed so in conclusion, it was a malfunction.

comment.text:
The bra puzzle is the easiest:
A bra is a miserable thing to wear on a hot humid hike. They took them off for comfort and stuck them in the shared back pack. There was no one around to see anything, just two women. I remove mine as soon as I'm out of sight on a trail, on a long car ride....just anywhere it isn't necessary, most women ditch a bra anywhere they can get away with it, but especially in heat and humidity. They only used one back pack to take turns carrying it, since they didn't intend to be gone long. The orbs in the photos are just reflections on moisture droplets in the air. I've captured those in photos on a rainy or muggy night. I'm guessing here- but they probably took those 130+ photos that night because they heard someone or something nearby and they tried to signal help (or scare it away) with the flash. They were being very resourceful.

comment.text:
My beat friend served a 2 year church mission in the remote Panama areas as a service mission doing service for the native people. Church missionaries never carry cash and usually don’t have any at all, they mind their own business and very giving and loving kids 19-26 years old. My best friend after his mission told me all about his 2 years . As a church missionary he was robbed, held at knives point 12 TIMES in 22 months in 5 different areas he served in. He said the thieves knew their routes home and usually waited until they were in a remote stretch of land , then would walk them off the road or trail into the jungle and rob them.  He said half those times the robbers were very agressive and threatened them saying he should kill them so they don’t speak and 2 times they were told , “if you go to the police , nothing will happen except they will tell me you did.” Several indicating the police are on their sides.  They did report every case they felt they were in danger and not once were the police cooperative, never got back to them and absolutely no help. He said Panama was an extremely dangerous place and the church he belongs too about a decade ago pulled ALL their missionaries out of Panama for safety concerns. 
I mention this because a report I saw on this case said the police and locals avidly searched for these girls and it seems to infer the locals wouldn’t hurt 2 beautiful young scantily dressed (according to locals, we see the pictures their in shorts tank tops and swim suits which to locals could be considered that)  the church hd also NEVER allowed female missionaries to go to panama after the early 1990’s becasue of concern for their safety as 21 year old females, I’ve never heard of the church allowing men but not girls so soenthing happened on several occasions to pull all females out for good.  These examples and concerns paint a very dangerous place for foreigners who are often seen as easy targets becasue they’re homes are thousands of miles away.  Sexual assault/rape are common among locals but authorities do nothing so to me it seems obvious these two pretty Caucasian foreigners were noticed by a local and followed or ran into them on the trail. I’d guess SA was involved where the photo of a bloody head of one of the girls was on the camera.  I hadn’t heard they hd a solar charger , the other documentary said they were trying to conserve the phones battery becasue they were lost and it died days after disappearing. A solar charger obviously eliminates a worry about phone dying or the possibility and makes sense that two extremely educated girls traveling the world performing service in a 3rd world country would bring a solar powered battery bank so I buy that.  The clean backpack showing up missing most items indicates someone robbed them or took things after kidnapping or murdering them washing the backpack before placing it in the open where it would be found.  After assaulting them a local would know the jungle wildlife would take care of the bodies if they did already dismember. The shoe and Foote SO far from the trail they were taking tells me they were walked far from that trail knowing people would search the trail. The police according to the parents said they were searching but ended up feeling like they didn’t care and didn’t believe they had searched like stated with investigators rarely returning calls or helping once the parents arrived.  
It’s obvious to me with Panamas history of late they were murdered and I feel angry for the parents hearing true crime channels and documentaries pushing that the girls were just young and naive and got lost sucoming to the elements. None of the facts make sense to that suggestion. The phone attempted calls, pictures and the mystery deleted photo deleted AFTER their disappearance, the bloody head, the photos of nothing , a foggy sky wierd angles of jungle which would be someone not familiar with cameras pushing buttons , the girls were extremely smart and independent not stupid. And the media pushing a false idea of the local police and not ever mentioning the insane crime rate, murder rates and rapes in Panama painting it as a safe place for 2 young girls and locals as angels and police as eager to find these girls. Given the facts and recent history it’s quite clear what happened we just don’t know the details. When people push that incorrect narrative it ruins the case becasue parents loose support because false infromation is spread and it demeans the victims and hurts the parents who know their daughters better.  I believe the parents words on the authorities and locals and my best friend and the church over Panamanian police mere words over the phone. If the media had spoke the truth about Panamas dark recent past and the United States governent suggesting Americans don’t travel to panama tells me it’s not safe for 2 pretty young girls . I’m a single dad of 3 amazing daughters that are my life and I’d be asking their travel plans and researching the places their going dissuading any remotely unsafe places for young girls. The FBI suggests young American females travel with adult chaperons when traveling outside the US becasue of human /sex trafficking of foreigners globally from Europe, Asia , Middle East , Taiwan, Phillipines, South America etc. I understand girls wanting to be independent but a dangerous country for locals and especially foreign tourists as a parent put your foot down or at least try to convey with facts the danger. My heart goes out to the parents and Justice will come to those responsible if not in this life , the next.

comment.text:
Things that are weird:
1. Those who take the Pianista know that it’s very difficult to get lost without trying. There’s one obvious trail to return on. At the time the girls disappeared, they would have known they needed to hustle back as it would take 2 hours to get back. Venturing off the path would be very foolish. 

2. If they decided to explore further, we would have seen more photos (?)

3. Why did they write “they” on a piece of the map? Who was “they”? Why did they place it next to the homemade flags?

4. The guide went to their [locked] rooms to check out the situation. Their key was not found in their belongings later on.

5. If they took the wrong trail why in the world would they keep going? Why wouldn’t they sit and wait right where they were?

6. How did the guide “happen” to find their remains?

7. Why was there another set of remains found near theirs? (A mother and an infant I think ). 

8.  The guide’s coffee farm was near the remains.

9. Why didn’t they document their ordeal or write a text draft to tell their family about it? People since the beginning of time have left messages to loved ones to let them know what happened when they know their time is about up.

10. Why only dial 911 once on the first day? Wouldn’t you obsessively dial emergency services in a panic on the first day?

11. The incorrect pin: I find it very hard to believe they didn’t share pins. 

12. The deleted photo

13. The photo of the back of Kris’s head. I see wounds or bruises at the base of her neck. Or, evidence of decomposition. Those dark marks are suspect to me.

I feel like something spooked them and they ran off the trail maybe. And that perhaps someone eventually caught up with them. They might have even been held against their will in the middle of the jungle.

comment.text:
I'd like to offer some insight on the random pictures in absolute darkness.  I'm @14:45 for reference so I apologize if this has been covered or will be covered shortly.  When I saw the images they instantly reminded me of a scary experience I had that my camera potentially saved me.  

I am a photographer who while on a trip to a dark zone (Lake Powell, Utah), decided to try my luck at some landscapes with the milky way.  I scoped out a spot during the afternoon that was literally 50 yards from our camp on the shoreline but a 1/4 mile hike because the camp was at the base of a canyon.  I found an easy path up and down the steep canyon walls that involved just a bit of scrambling, but I did it in flip flops multiple times and was ready.  Golden hour hits, I hike to the rim and post up, I start taking photo after photo into the night.  I am excited because it's the last night and every single night before, just as the sky would get dark enough for the milky way, the full moon would rise.  This was the first night that it would stay below the horizon long enough to shoot the milky way.  So it's like 12 am by the time the moon is lighting up the entire back and foreground so I decide to pack up and head back.  But then I instantly realize I have a problem.  I am standing in the shadow of a giant sandstone butte and I can barely see a thing.  I get back to the general area where I knew the little path back down was but I could not find it.  I walked back and forth for 20 minutes and started to get impatient.  I was about to just go for it and so glad I didn't before I had an idea.  My camera does not have a flash, a Nikon D780 and I had a wide angle f2.8.  I thought at first the screen would be bright enough to show me the way but it did nothing.  Finally I just cranked the ISO way up and took a few 10 or 20 second exposures and I turned night into daylight.  I could now see that I was standing directly above a 50 foot drop and that my path was further back the way I had came.  Snapping pics all along the way, I had no doubt now where I was going and I could suddenly see in the dark.  

Perhaps some of the random shots were simply the girl(s) attempting to find their way in complete darkness?

comment.text:
On every true crime video, it seems there's someone who comments how out of the many, many true crime cases they've watched, THAT one is the that sticks with them the most. This is that case for me--well, tied with the whole Turtle Island Thailand gang-corruption-coverup murders haha. 

Any theory on this case (or derivative) get be picked apart so it's frustrating. Some things start to make sense in your mind, it's all clicking together, and then you go "but wait, what about the ___ " So yeah the only thing i'm certain of is that i'm not certain. I do notice however, that people who support the theory that they just got lost (whether coupled with an animal attack, a fall of a cliff, effects of dehydration etc.) don't seem able or willing to refute arguments for the (a) foul play theory. 

Even to believe they were kidnapped by a gang would open up so many more questions that have left people scratching their heads. But I tend to lean towards some form of the foul play theory, and here why.

Points that contradict the theory that they just got lost:

1) the backpack -- it was found 70 days after the girls' disappearance, beside a river bank 15 km away from the pianista trail. The lady who found it said she was at the same spot the day before but didn't see any backpack there. The backpack was NOT wet -- it was in pristine condition and the items inside were dry and appeared untouched. The phones and digital camera were in there, so it becomes difficult to see how the girls could've been the ones taking the pictures and calling emergency services in the jungle for 11 days, and yet the backpack doesn't get wet or dirty, and somehow makes a long journey on its own without getting wet. 

2) Lisanne's severed left foot was found in her hiking boot, and the cut was clean -- This disproves any animal attack theory and shows a human being cut off her foot. Unless Pokemon are real and a Scyther jumped out and cut her foot off, then it was a human. It can't be argued that an animal could have done that, plus the boot was clean and still tied to her foot, with no sign of scratches or claw marks

Honestly, I don't see how anyone can believe they just got lost given the above 2 points. Ok let's tack on some more for goal differential :P

3) Pictures -- I'm hoping people have watched/read other things about this case, to gather more details. The daytime pictures and nighttime pictures tell completely different (albeit incomplete) stories. 

Timeline: they start their hike on April 1st. Yikes, I didn't even notice that was April Fool's, ugh. 

-> daytime pictures - The girls are smiling. These are the ones at the foot of the trail, along it and leading up to them reaching the peak where I wish they had been able to turn back. In the strange pictures of Kris beside the stream of water and crouched by the bushes, she's not smiling at all and some believe at this point they were either kidnapped or had run into another group and knew they were dangerous.

 These initial pictures were taken before 1:30-2:00pm, so that refutes the taxi driver saying he dropped them off at that time. Nope, he might've just misremembered but this notion that they started their hike at 2pm is simply false. MORE on that taxi driver in a bit ....

> nighttime pictures - After 2pm on April 1st, no one used the camera for 7 days. It just doesn't make sense, if they were alone and simply lost, to not have a SINGLE picture of them, or anything in the daytime for that matter. But then on April 8th, someone took more than 90 photos in less than 3 hours - those hours were between 1am-4am. This is where the "they just got lost" camp suggests that these photos were meant to light up the area so they could see their surroundings, perhaps signal an airplane or search party, or perhaps scare off an animal they (or rather just she, by this point) might have heard. I have to admit, whyy would kidnappers be out at 1-4am taking pictures though? Best chance to not be seen as they make it look like the girls took the pictures in the jungle? Oh, I dunno. But then again, WHY was there 0 camera activity for 7 days?

Then there's the deleted photo and this one's a mammoth. Keep in mind that pictures were taken on a digital camera, not their phones. A computer must be used to fully erase a photo, and the Canon company itself confirmed this. It makes a strong argument that the girls managed to get a picture of something or someone incriminating, and whoever kidnapped them (* cough Feliciano Gonzales) had to have deleted the picture. 

4) Phones -- alright so on the first day, April 1st, the first emergency call to 112 was placed just after 4:30pm. Then a call was placed to 911 but didn't get through. Then phones turned off for 14 hours. Again, why? If they were lost and had their phones, how do they both go 14 hours without having their phone on? 

In total, they made about 80 calls. On day 5 (April 5th) LIsanne's phone died. Kris's phone stayed on until day 11 but between April 7th-10th Kris's phone was off/had no activity. It was turned on again, for the last time, at 10:51am on April 11th. It was turned off exactly an hour later at 11:51am, and this was the end of any phone activity. 

On April 6th, there were several attempts to enter an incorrect code. There were dozens of attempts up until April 11th. The girls obviously would have exchanged pass codes so it's very unlikely that Lisanne would've been locked out of Kris's phone. Plus, they didn't need a pass code to make an emergency call so investigators concluded it was unlikely to have been Lisanne trying to enter the code. The girls hadn't called home or the place they were staying, or anything other than emergency services in those 11 days so that seemed a bit strange. Why "dozens" of attempts to enter a phone, unless it was kidnappers looking for photos or something before they plant the phones in the backpack and leave them by the river. 

5) Tour guide / gang members 
Oh I gotta wrap this up. No one's reading anyway but I can't sleep so let's write until the eyes get heavy haha. Okay but yeah, let's go over some of these characters.

Feliciano Gonzales - the tour guide
Internet sleuths like me believe he's our guy. He basically IS a red flag, everything that he does. The girls were supposed to meet with Feliciano but they didn't. So after the girls went missing, he went over to the place they were staying and was in the girls' room for 30 minutes. There wasn't a door key in the backpack that was found, which doesn't make sense. Then of course it's Feliciano who spotted the boot with Lisanne's severed foot in it, and other bones. 33 bones were discovered, one pair of jean shorts, and one shoe from each of the girls. Then there was a rolled up ball of human skin. Then you look at Feliciano's tripadvisor reviews online and the one where he threatens a woman with a machete sticks out. Machete, clean cut above the ankle, hmm. OH, and then the suspicious deaths. Over 10 people connected to the case have died, including 4 member of the Los gang. The one gang member who survived? Henri Elizas Gonzales, Feliciano's son. Alright. 

Taxi driver -- named Leonardo Gonzales -- drove the girls to la pianista, told police he saw a pickup truck near where he dropped the girls off. He was found dead in a river, 7 months after the girls' disappearance.

Gang member 1 - Osman Velezuales (23 years old) - died April 4th (3 days after the girls' disappearance). 

2 - Juan Rivera Miranda (24)
3 - Jorge Murgas (23)
4 - Adonis Henriberto (23)

One was drowned in a shallow pool, one hit and run, and I forget the other. I'm tired, still need to look up another supposed suspect named Plineo Montenegro. 

But yeah, again no one will have read this but forgive the long rant, anyway. This case just has so many strange elements to it. I mean, the girls actually had a compass, a solar power bank, and a knife in their room. They obviously would've taken these if they planned to go on a long hike, which further makes me believe they were intercepted at some point on the trail. 

It just seems obvious that there was foul play involved. Foul play's a euphemism for what Lisanne and Kris went through, and I can't see any way they just got lost. Again they didn't pack much, they didn't take any daytime photos after the first 2 hours of their hike, the condition of the bone fragments, the knowledge of gang/police/government corruption in Panama, all of it. If they were lost, wouldn't they have tried to mark where they've been? It's dense jungle but even little pieces of clothing tied to a tree could be seen by people searching. What about trying to make SOS signs out of rocks or sticks?> Or at least make piles of random sticks and brush so you'll know you've been there before, and people searching can tell a human made those piles. 

I dunno, it just seems a bit disrespectful to the girls and their lives to believe they were foolish and got lost. Just think, if Lisanne or Kris was your daughter, would you be able to look at this case and accept that the girls must've just got lost? Evidence for them being lost pales in comparison to them being kidnapped, does it not?

Then again, I could be wrong :)

comment.text:
In the disappearance of these two Dutch girls, there are two situations that I don't understand and I believe that need a more careful analysis:
1-If in the first two calls to the Dutch emergency number, they were already under the control of kidnappers, why didn't the criminals take the phones, the camera and all their belongings?

This doesn't make any sense! No offenders with murderous or sexual intentions would risk being photographed by their victims, or even risk the girls calling the police or leaving a message recorded on their cell phones for when they are found by the authorities.

2- Why don't you have any attempt to call 911 during the night?

What would be the worst moment for two girls from an urban environment, lost in the middle of a tropical jungle?
Do you agree with me that this worst moment would be to spend the night in the forest?! Exhausted, cold, with animals moving on the ground, animal movement in the dark forest, a plague of insects, rain spray, hunger, thirst and darkness everywhere. This would undoubtedly be the time when they would most try to connect to an emergency number, but they didn't.

Trying to explain these two situations, the best way to harmonize was as follows:
Lisanne and Kris decided on their own, to continue the trail past the viewpoint, when they realized they couldn't make it back before nightfall, or because they really got lost and disoriented, they decided to make the first two calls in the late afternoon of April 1st. . Without success, they must surely have screamed for help. They were certainly answered and rescued by someone who heard them both scream, or someone who somehow passed them on the trail. This would explain why the girls did not attempt to call an emergency number during the night, that is, they felt safe to be accompanied by someone they believed to be trustworthy and well intentioned.
After that, they certainly went with that someone, to some nearby property, where they continued to be deceived by lies that reassured them, but that at dawn and after a night's sleep, they always tried to make another emergency call, until the cell phone battery has discharged.
It was at that moment that this someone realized that they were totally incommunicado and certainly decided to attack and take their belongings that were all inside the backpack.
From then on, all the evil that befell the girls began.

In my opinion, between the moment the last cell phone ran out of charge and the dawn of the 8th, Kris Kremers was killed, so in the photos taken on the 8th, only the hair of a lifeless body of Kris appears, trying to simulate a disappearance, with them lost in the night trying to signal their position in the woods and kris dead in Lisanne's arms (who doesn't appear in the photos) as it's the killer planting false evidence, not Lisanne!

As the pieces of Lisanne Froon's skin were found in mid-June, in an initial state of decomposition, this shows that Lisanne was killed in early June and was under the control of this someone who killed her, for about 60 days. She was the last to die.

Note 1: Seeing the holes in Kris' Jeans, it shows that her dead body was dragged a short distance, where it was thrown. That is, this may indicate that the place where Kris and Lisanne were killed and the bodies were subjected to a chemical treatment for dismemberment and then concealment, are very close to each other, and may be in the vicinity of this property where they felt "safe" .

Note 2: Kris' boot found, was it clean and without any remains inside? No animal in the forest, would be interested in carrying a leather boot in her mouth! It's not food! That's how the animals would see this boot, any object, they would have smelled it and gone. That boot was taken to the forest by the killer.

Note 3: The police know of more evidence, maybe even the photo that was deleted. At the very least, they want to make some strategic use.

Conclusion: Kris Kremers and Lisanne Froon, were held captive in an environment they thought was safe, were killed, stripped naked, with the bodies being dismembered by some chemical process as yet unknown. Some dismembered parts, along with the girls' boots, clothes and backpack with all the girls' belongings, were deliberately abandoned along the straight-line trail to create false leads and simulate that the girls died of hunger and thirst after getting lost in the deep in the forest.

The death of these innocent girls touched me a lot! This is my small contribution to unravel their deaths and thus lead to a punishment, the possible murderer and the possible collaborators.

Fortaleza-CE, Brazil.

I very much hope that Jesus Christ will comfort Kris and Lisanne's parents.
comment.author: @eliaslima5506

comment.text: To Scarlett. You have done a tremendous amount of work on this case. I only heard about this horrific tragedy 3 days ago. I have read a day's worth of your work. In the beginning of my own research I was more on the fence and receptive to the lost in the woods theory. In general it would be the most likely scenario. But as you've clearly argued in all of your work, this is no ordinary disappearance. I have spent a lot of time on the 'lost' theory because I feel that it should be 100 percent ruled out before claiming things we have no proof for. But I definitely lean foul play. If the facts of this case are to be believed there are just too many  coincidences for it to be simply getting lost. Even though getting lost and succumbing to the elements  would be a likely scenario, I think the conspiracy theory here is actually coming from those who want blame inexperienced yet intelligent and cautious women. Like how do these foul play deniers explain Lisanne's rolled up ball of skin and foot in boot with skin just lying undisturbed for Feliciano to find right after all that reward money was offered? Kris' bleached pelvic bone? I've l heard the rebuttals and they're extremely weak. The thing about the getting lost theory is it makes sense until you familiarize yourself with the trail. It's straightforward. Hard to deviate from. There's also traffic. The injury theory makes little sense as both girls would have to be injured to the point of being unable to walk. Highly unlikely and as evidenced in the walk along videos there's nowhere along the path the girls could have got that severely injured before their first emergency call. The phone usage, or lack thereof, after 4:51 pm for me is the most damning thing. Their first night lost alone in the woods and neither turns their phone on again for 14 hours? I get that it would be intelligent to conserve battery power. I just don't believe anybody in that situation would or could sit in pitch black cool as a cucumber for 7 days straight. They couldn't have been that far away at 4:39 the time of their first emergency call. They had no reason to conserve their battery power if they believed they could probably hike back day 2 first thing. To me it is supposing way too much to say both girls were injured to the point of not being able to call for help on the trail. It's too much to say one couldn't walk or try to crawl back to Boquette for help. The girls did not send one pending message to loved ones that would automatically send if they happened upon service. They left no photos or video messages for 11 days with battery power. And photo 509 was deleted manually off a computer unless some absolute miracle took place. The conspiracy theorist here is the one lacking context making general assumptions. The ones who want to believe Panama is no more dangerous than their comfortable first world community. It's really hard not to be biased in favor of the foul play theory if you are honest with yourself about the lost theory inconsistencies. There is always the chance these girls got lost and were then eventually abducted. But in my opinion their lack of attempting help after 4:51 pm April 1st for the next 14 hours leads me to believe either their phones were taken from them. Or. This might be easily debunked. But is it possible there were photos taken and deleted from the phones and camera before the 99 taken on April 8th? Because surely there'd be no sign of these photos taken before the 8th unless competent law enforcement sought to look into potentially deleted files. The login pins on both phones were successfully typed in the first 4 days. So it would seem likely the girls had at least partial access to their phones. Maybe they werent kidnapped in the sense that we think of at gun point violently. Like some men were forcing them to stay with them off trail out of wifi service and threatened violence if a phone were used. All speculation, but that would make sense of why the phones were hardly ever used but the login attempts remained accurate. Again though maybe the girls were forced into giving up their login codes so whoever might have kidnapped them could delete what could have incriminated them. It doesn't make a lot of sense to me that someone could become so disoriented through hypothermia that they couldn't ever again remember their simple login. It is possible though. But it still doesn't explain away never taking a photo or video of anything sensible for over a week yet they logged in and out. To me it's clear these women couldn't openly use their phones or camera when they wanted. The technology usage of first worlders is minute to minute. The usage of people living in Panama would be here and there once or twice a day. That's how those pieces of technology were used after 4:51 pm. Once or twice a day. Panama is a dangerous place with a lot of murder. There are experienced murderers and shitty law enforcement. Those arguing the lost theory want to believe in it so bad for their own little ego trip or because they're lacking necessary context. I look at it as more of a virtue signaling to other reasonable explanation people looking for quick resolution. There was an alleged murderer in the US who was just charged and due to his being video recorded by his child victims. Had he kept the girls alive long enough to extract a login pin and social media password he could have erased the video evidence entirely. This to me is why the criminals in the Kris and Lisanne case were so preoccupied with the phone. The lost in the wood side would say why not destroy the phones, camera and backpack and be done with it. That happened to that Alex guy on that trail 5 years earlier. Disappeared into thin air. So it was treated like a crime. Had evidence of a body or belonging been planted that case wouldn't have been under the microscope. That's why I believe body parts and belongings were released back into the woods. In hopes to pass off the murders as human error. I think potential criminals woulda weighed this destroying all evidence option at first but were trying really hard to cover their tracks with the phone. Meanwhile most likely trying to blend in and contributing to the manhunt that first week. To make sure they weren't being incriminated. I also believe a third party would hold onto the phone while they eliminated all other evidence first. That spot where the possible sos was photographed was likely where the bodies were. One thing that does bother me about the foul play theory though is DNA on the phones and camera. Was there any DNA found or looked for? You would think it would be difficult to eliminate all DNA traces without some sort of noticeable damage. So strange though that the phones were just found neatly packed away. And if I remember correctly there was like some traces of edible snack in the bag. You would think in starvation that would be gobbled up. So many things make no sense and it's human nature to try and find a plausible answer. Some people dream up over the top scenarios, others downplay everything and want the most basic, reasonable explanation based on their own mundane human experience. To me most of everything on both sides cancels itself out or is inadequately explained. Except for the body parts found and the absence/lack of phone/camera use until the early morning hours of the 8th. Nothing can explain away these things for me. To argue otherwise and assume murderers arent intelligent enough or capable enough to cover their tracks is just downright naive. Anyway those are my 2 cents.

comment.text: Here's what Occam's razor tells us. The girls finished the hike quicker than they expected and decided to walk on a bit further (or they thought it was a loop track). People, including their parents, say it's impossible to wonder of the trail because it is so obvious. But that doesn't factor in if they intentionally went off the trail because they ran out of water. It has been established that they took very little water on their hike that day. They could hear the river nearby so they went down to fill their water bottles. Unfortunately they didn't realise how steep it was and they slipped and fell and suffered critical injuries. People wonder why they didn't try more emergency calls, it's because they were stuck in the same spot the entire time, broken backs or broken legs or broken hips, or all of these. They tried to conserve battery by switching their phones off. But they realised the emergency calls were futile given the lack of service in that one spot. The girls sheltered against the cliff and spread their rubbish to signal to anyone looking over the cliff or from the sky. One photo shows the white papers forming an SOS. The red plastic bags (proven to be from the village) was also a signal/marker while they sheltered closer to the cliff to stay out of the elements. They tried to take a photo of Kris head injury. Kris eventually dies. Lisanne either doesn't know or forgot Kris' pincode after her own phone battery died. The reason they went silent for a week is because they knew it was futile. They decided to conserve battery and wait for help. The night photos were taken because Lisanne could hear either helicopters that day/night or the audio signals the search and rescue were using. She was using the camera flash to try and signal them but slowly loses hope which is why the photos begin to slow down and get further apart. This may have also been Lisannes last efforts to signal for help before succumbing to her injuries/dehydration/starvation. If you want to find the site where they died it is somewhere upstream (obviously) from the evidence found, bones, backpack, shorts etc. The river Changuinolla starts not far from El Mirador. The location they died will be on the western side of the river on a steep section with a large rock and open canopy somewhere between the location of the shorts and El Mirador. If you can find this location there will be some remnants of the rubbish they left. It will also be where the animals pulled apart their bodies so perhaps there would even be some bones, hopefully for the families sakes, the skulls. The missing photo was either a glitch in the camera software or the Panamanian police deleted it, that is the ONLY conspiracy theory worth investigating. There was no foul play, no murder, no gangs, no cartel, no Photoshop (absolute nonsense). Just two girls that slipped and fell and suffered unimaginable pain and fear for a week in the Panamanian jungle. Someone please find this location so the girls May finally rest in peace.

comment.text: Cette histoire de photo 509 est troublante. Normalement la photo effacée n'est plus récupérable si des données ont été réécrite sur la mémoire de la carte a l'endroit ou se trouvait la photo : soit par une des 90 photos de la seconde série (mais impossible si cette photo a été effacé après cette série), soit avec un logiciel particulier réécrivant des données sur les parties non utilisées de la mémoire (la faut être expert et un ordinateur), soit en remplissant l'espace libre de la carte avec des fichiers jusqu'a ce qu'elle soit pleine et en effacant ensuite ces fichiers (ca n'importe qui peut le faire avec un ordinateur). Deux hypothèses supplémentaires : soit l'effacement a partir de l'appareil est complètement sécurisé (il réécrit sur ces données -a mon avis peu probable-), soit le gars qui a fait l'expertise de cette carte était de mèche-ou pas assez compétent. comment.text:
I have a theory about the photos taken on their camera at night. I’ve camped in the jungle, including in Panama (always with a guide). There are 2 things to know about the jungle at night:

1) It is PITCH black. You can’t even see your hand in front of your face. The trees block out the moon and stars.

2) The jungle comes alive at night. You hear rustling bushes, scampering feet, and animals making all sorts of noises

There have been many times I’ve turned on my flashlight in the middle of the night just to figure out what is making noises. It can be frightening, especially without a tent for protection.

My theory is that they took the night photos because they heard animal noises and the flash was their only source of light. The close-up of her hair may have been a “is there something crawling on me??” situation

comment.text:
I'm certain it was not foul play and I can give natural explanations for pretty much all the unusual events.
     I believe they made it to the second monkey bridge and Kris fell off it and was severely injured. This was when the first emergency call attempt was made.
     For five days, almost perfectly routine, they made attempts to contact emergency services. They gave up trying on the 6th of April to make any more attempts.
      They never left the river where Kris was injured. Probably a broken leg or fractured foot. 
     The night photos on the 8th make perfect sense. They were trying to illuminate the tree canopy to create a larger signal beacon. It failed because no hikers or native villagers would have been out in the rain to see it.
     I believe they survived up to the 11th. But I think Kris might not of woke up on the morning of the 11th and Lisanne tried in a very weakened state to try emergency call.
    If you get into their minds. 

For 5 days you try emergency calls, yelling for help. 
     "Where are the searchers? Is no one coming? No one cares that we have been gone for five days?"
    
 Now you tack on five more days. By the 11th of April they gave up. No one cares we have been missing for 10 days. Hopelessness sets in, you are starving, exhausted, wet and possibly in physical pain.
      Why was the night photo of Kris's hair "clean" and "dry".
Kris probably used one of the backpacks as a pillow. The tangled hair kind of proves sleeping on a backpack.
     $83 found in one backpack. Seems strange that a 3rd party wouldn't just take the money.
     It seems silly that some suggest the camera photos were edited by 3rd party but I see zero evidence of that theory.
     The "missing" 509 photo. Nope not missing at all. The SD card had been removed. The photo button pressed with no card slotted and it counted 509 into memory. No flash is triggered when you do this. So the memory SD card was reinserted and photo 510 was recorded and allowed the flash to trigger. 
    Why was the SD card first removed? They wanted to use the flash as a beacon but didn't want to save the photos. But they discovered the flash won't trigger if the SD card is not inserted.
     They both died of natural causes very close to the river. Scavenger animals fed on their bodies. The river washed down their remains taking the backpacks with it.
     Why was Kris's jean shorts removed?
They had gotten soaked on the night April 7th to early morning of the 8th. The next dry day probably the 10th Lisanne took them to dry them in the sun. They were never put back on because Kris had passed a way.

comment.text:
Consider that there are Several photographs taken apparently in just one or so minutes as the two friends arrive on the summit at 13.00pm, the next photo is then of Kris Kremers racing down the gully at 13.20pm looking back joyously at the camera. So, how long were the two at the top and how long does it take to get from the summit to this Gulley? From what Hans Kremers indicates here the gully is just as you leave the summit. There is another 34 minutes till the next photo - at the stream - and according to Hans Kremers apparently it takes 45 minutes thereabouts to reach the stream location from the summit, so the gulley must be just as you leave the summit to head down. The last photo of the day is marked on the camera as 13.54pm with the two reaching the stream. Meaning that according to the Kremers own timing Kris and Lisanne would have been on the summit for around ten minutes... indeed allow for the fact that the Kremers here are walking in muddy conditions and with a party, while Kris and Lisanne were younger and moving over dry ground in good weather, and I suggest that there may well be a considerable time spent on the Summit, in fact if the Photo of Kris in the gulley looking back at Lisanne is stamped as 13.20pm and the gulley is just as you leave the Summit you would have close to twenty minutes of them proved to be on the Summit. One minute or so to energetically shoot several very quick photo's as they arrive there apparently and they abruptly stop, what then were they doing then for the next fifteen minutes or more? Before they decide to descend the other side?

It does make you wonder whether at this point, as they arrived there on the Summit and celebrated, does someone arrive and talk them into a trip down the other side with him...? We can never know. But it does make sense then as to why it is Kris is always seen ahead by that point, the path is not big enough for three people together, at least one of them has to walk out in front.

It is a very interesting possibility to think on.

comment.text:
They got lost 100% (I excuse for a certain length of the following comment)

Why would a perpetrator wait so long ? A Jungle at night is pitch black, you cant see your own hand, its that dark. So if there was someone he would have lead them into the forest, killed them and then would have taken their belongings to a place no one would look for, all in daylight, the forest would make it possible. 

In the night, there is a high chance the perpetrator himself would not be able to orientate very well and get lost himself, especially considering how far in they already were...its just unnecessary. 

Its much much much more likely they got lost:
To me it seems Kris was the more naive one, doesnt want to carry a backpack, is always walking in front and seems very curious overall. 
They both were highly unexperienced with the terrain, underprepared in regard to equipment and ill informed about a route that was difficult to navigate even for locals. I mean they both came from a highly urbanised country...the weather was very nice that day and overall there is a trail that they can follow....why not just walk a bit further down the path and see what we can find (maybe they heard rumors about secret places or stuff like that). The photos implicate a certain light hearted attitude. On the last daytime photo Kris does look a bit uncertain tho, no bright smile like in the other photos. I think at that point they realized they got lost but didnt panic or think of any mortal consequences. After that daytime photos stop, probably because at that point there were way more important things to do than take silly photos (search network connection, try to orientate, make waypoints etc.) 

Then come the nighttime photos. These got analyzed in depth (you cant really get more out of these at this point) and the overall concensus is that they tried to either orientate or more probably to signal their location, hence a lot of them are at the same spot and directed in the sky. At that point panic had set in for sure. Anyone who got lost once in a forest knows that panic sets in faster and faster the lower the sun sets, I cant imagine how horrified I would be in a south american jungle with all the animal noises plus being dehydrated and disoriented. 

I think Kris was the first who couldnt move forward at some point, possibly due to an injury like a fracture from a fall (the terrain would make that easy especially at night and panicked)
I think Lisanne was the more collected one, making almost all the photos and trying to use Kris phone.
Lisanne did sustain a injury herself, evident by the fracture on the foot that was found. 
First Kris was unable to move, Lisanne tried to call for help and at some point had an accident herself, so that both of them succumbed to the elements. Rain and the small river scattered their remains.

comment.author: @bobafeet1234

comment.text:
Why I Think Foul Play Was Involved:

1) Kris' hair appears to look way too good, after 8 long days lost in the jungle.

Spending 8 days in a jungle with lots of rain, dirt, plants, insects, etc. and your hair being that clean 8 days after getting lost in a jungle is just ridiculous. Many speculate that Kris fell and got injured early on in their disappearance, you mean to tell me she fell and her hair was completely untouched? no twigs, dirt, nothing? okay. I'm sorry but personally my hair would look completely messed up after 1 night being lost in a jungle, never mind 8.

Some say that Kris' might of washed her hair, I just really doubt that.

First, you think her dirty hair would really be a concern for her, being lost for days in a foreign jungle far far from home?

Second, they had no hair products on them. Washing hair with just river water would leave it looking frizzy, not like the hair that looks like on photos from April 1st.

2) Before going to the Pianista trail, locals have said that they saw the girls being approached by an off road vehicle.

Please be aware that I am not accusing any of these people specifically of harming the girls, as that would be not fair without more evidence.

After the girls had a short conversation with the locals, they were approached by tour guide Feliciano's off road vehicle. Son of Feliciano, Henry Gonzalez, was driving that vehicle. He was accompanied by his friend Jose Manuel Murgas.

Henry offered the girls a ride to the Pianista trail, which was only 5 minutes away from that point.

The girls accepted the ride and got to the Pianista trail to begin their hike, alone. So those boys had the information that the girls were alone.

Now like I said, this doesn't mean that it was them specifically that did something to the girls, but they had the information that they were alone. Whether or not they passed on this information to other third parties, we don't know.

This is still some crucial information.

3) That same off road vehicle picked up the girls after they returned

This was witnessed by 2 locals.

One of these locals was the taxi driver - Leonardo Arturo Gonzalez.

Leonardo apparently knew more than he publicly stated about what he witnessed.

Leonardo later was found drowned, on March 3rd 2015. Just before the case was closed.

My theory is that Leonardo was killed because he knew something that the killers didn't want him to. To prevent him from spilling this information to unwanted sources, the killers took his life.

The girls were witnessed heading to the road by locals between 2:30pm - 3:30pm, 5 hours after their start time.

This time is consistent with the time it actually takes to hike the Pianista trail, and return back from the hike.

The witness stated that the girls looked like they already walked a good amount, so it is possible that he saw them after their returned from their hike.

Now to the main point, the same off road vehicle that drove the girls to the hike, picked them up from the hike. There were 3 guys in the car: Henry Gonzalez, Jose Manuel Murgas, and Osman Valenzuela.

A popular theory is that they headed to Caldera Hot Springs, to relax after a long day of hiking. Seems logical to me.

4) Panamanian authorities botched this case from the very beginning.

A Dutch journalist mentioned the unprofessionalism by the Panamanian authorities to investigate the case at a criminal level.

This is a snippet from a video featuring what he said:

"For too long they considered a possible accident, or a possible case of them getting lost. And all that time they didn't invest in a proper criminal investigation. Therefore, very crucial time has been lost. Within hours, at the last days but ideally sooner, you need to interview all witnesses, in a very intensive and thorough manner. You need to do technical research very early on and investigate telephone data."

It is no secret that the Panamanian authorities neglected this case from the very beginning, how can you be this careless and irresponsible?

The families of the girls filed a lawsuit against the Panamanian authorities for the mishandling of the evidence.

Were they trying to cover something up?

A motive for covering the truth could be that they wanted to paint the picture that the girls were lost in order to protect their tourism reputation. That is what I personally believe.

5) Tampering of camera / SD card.

Most here already know about image 509 here, so I won't go in too much detail about that.

But image 509, the photo between last day photo and first night photo, was safe deleted.

Safe deleting requires a special computer software.

If the image was just simply deleted from the camera, a professional would still be able to retrieve this image using a computer. That was not the case.

The Dutch authorities themselves came to a conclusion that the camera and SD card were tampered with, so this is no secret.

In my opinion, image 509 was something that the Panamanian authorities absolutely did not want anyone to see. And this doesn't have to mean that 509 showed the girls injured/dead or showed their murderers or anything like that, but it could have simply been a picture that was not on the trail or near the jungle. In order to depict their narrative of the girls being "lost in a jungle", the Panamanian authorities destroyed this image.

comment.text:
There's so much infornation missing:
- the photos in the camera are out of order, and when put in order show that the girls went up and then down.
Probably the manipulation, that had to be done by the local police, was made to sustain the story that the girls never returned from the hike. In fact, it is obvious when you look at all the photos and realized that one girl had the hair pushed back on the way up and loose on the way down. Otherwise she would have been constantly catching and released her hair. Also, one of the girls is carrying the backpack on the way up and the other on the way down. The local authorities didn't want the area, which was a touristic one, to get famous as a unsafe area for tourists.
- the girls were seen after the hike by the owner of a local shop at the start of the trail and were asking for a taxi or lift back to the city. They end up entering a red car, driven by some local boys. That local was never interviewed by the authorities, but he spoke to some amateur investigators and the video is on youtube.
- one of those local boys is seen in one of the photos, swiming. The girls went home to pick their swiming suits and left right away with the boys to a waterfall. That is the reason why their bras were in the backpack, they were swiming at the waterfall, therefore they were wearing the swimming suits.
- the crime happened in that waterfall.
- the local guide went to their apartment and cleaned all the evidences that they returned from the hike. He did that because his son was one of the local boys that... well, used the girls to have some fun.
- all the three boys were dead one or two years after the disappearance. Some under strange situations.
The idea is that they were being killed to eliminate the witnesses of the crime, and the last one was killed by someone else. The taxi driver that took them to the start of the trail was also dead soon after the facts.
- why would anyone from Holand dial 911, when that number is irrelevant for an European? They used the 112 because that is the standard emergency number. Who dialed 911 was someone local that knew that that was the correct number, but the girls had no idea about that.

- The main theory is that the local police tried to "solve" the case by claiming the girls did something wrong, like walking to the jungle and getting lost. They manipulated the photos to sustain that story, by taking some strange photos that couldn't be used to identify the location but to give the idea they were alive, when they were already dead. Remember that they were raped and killed in the waterfall, by those 3 boys. Probably they were kept alive some time to be rapped multiple times, but when they tried to escape they were killed.

comment.text:
Excellent video! My theory is that their captor(s) didn't realize the women still had their cell phones, so the women had to be discreet about when they attempted to call for help and do it when their captors weren't looking. This would explain why they only checked their phones or attempted to call 911 during daylight hours as lighting up their phones at night would be more noticeable. It also explains why they never checked their phones or attempted to call at exactly the same time (probably one of them was talking to / distracting their captor(s) while the other attempted it). It might explain why Froon left her phone on all night on April 2-3 and wasted so much precious battery; she almost got caught and had to stow the phone without turning it off. From April 5 onward, Kremers was either dead or incapacitated, while Froon's phone was out of power; hard to say whether it was Froon trying to operate Kremers' phone without knowing her PIN, or whether their captors had finally discovered the phones and wanted to see what was on the phones. 

Me personally, if I was lost in the wild, I'd probably be attempting to get a signal and call for help every hour on the hour for the first day before I'd start doing it more sporadically to conserve battery. Something or someone was preventing them from calling for help more often. 

By April 8th, I think the captors had realized they f'ed up, that "missing pretty white woman" is a thing and the heat was on and a 6'0" tall white woman plus a 5'7"/5'8" white woman weren't going to just vanish without anyone noticing, so they shot all of the nighttime photos to make it look like the women had gotten lost. This included a staged toilet paper / mirror SOS photo. They planted the backpack and the bone fragments when they felt safe to do so, that way people would say, "Case closed, they got lost in the jungle" and stop looking for them.

comment.text: Is anyone else filled with a kind of deep sadness after hearing about this case? I've been thinking about it and returning to it for a week now and I just can't get it out of my head. The photos of these girls last trip didn't feature anything gruesome, but looking at their smiling faces knowing what is about to happen is probably one of the creepiest, scariest and saddest thing I have ever seen... especially once day turns to night and we see all those photos probably taken by a panicked Lisanne which may have just witnessed her best friends death moments ago. comment.text:
Hey. Late to the party. Here's information:

Two separate accidents. 

One fell off a cliff; the shots of the night sky are from the ground, the camera pointed up as a beacon. All of the pictures can be overlaid, to show that they are literally all from the same pov, same place, etc. Chances are a sprain, broken leg maybe, but they were more worried about a head wound, that's why there's pictures of her head. Possible concussion, maybe worse. 

The trail they were on, was largely unmarked at the time. It's one where you walk in a direction, get to a place, then walk back. At the time, there was no sign saying OKAY YOURE HERE GO HOME but apparently there is now. I'm guessing they saw something ahead of them, that looked like the next part of the trail they had already been following, and just kept walking.

The missing photo probably happened because the camera went off at the same time the battery got jostled. It makes a corrupt photo that the camera deletes automatically. I had a similar digital camera, it happens. I also literally have the same samsung s3 phone, until i heard that she accidentally left it on, i was surprised it's battery died first. My one, if you have it fully charged, can keep a charge for over a week. It's only when I use it excessively that the battery drains. 

The other accident came when they tried to cross a monkey bridge. These are notorious for being difficult. They were upstream somewhere, finally found something manmade, and were so SO close to help. 

as for the bleached bones, they werent bleached. they were scavenged by fire ants. the excretions from those are very phosphorous, which cleans bones in a similar fashion.

There's no grand conspiracy here. The ONE thing that was suspicious was their bag turning up. That was probably found by someone, realized it was evidence but didn't wanna get involved.

No, this was just bad luck. They were smart, they kept to a routine, didn't waste their phone batteries, managed to clear a lot of ground while injured. Honestly, you couldn't hope for better from them. I wish they had just created a big fire or something, but there's no mention of them having matches or a lighter, so they probably couldn't. They were smart, and definitely had endurance. Gorgeous too.

comment.text:
The two Dutch girls never hiked on the Pianista trail on 01 April 2014. At least three witnesses saw them that day in mid-afternoon coming back from a short hike on another nearby trail 
called Piedre de Lino. As mentioned by other locals, walking along the Pianista trail is like walking 
in people's backyard; houses and farms are strewn all along its path and cattle crossing is frequent. Even Kris's parents had to stop and let them pass. It's not a jungle but more a forest. One cannot get lost here for more than a day. 

One must also remember in what condition the Kris's camera was found: in perfect working order inside an almost pristine backpack that supposedly spent two months near or in a river. The two smartphones were also in similar condition. It is also well established that the photos taken from Kris's camera on 01 April were photoshopped. The night photos are of no significance & were added only as a diversion. All this in order to impose the official narrative *Two lost girls dying in the unforgiving jungle*.  Sadly the girls were abducted & murdered. The three or four still living suspects are well known.
